_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/10/2015 10:06:38 using v2.7
title: What proportion of calls are resolved without a person needing to go to hospital?
analysis_commentary:
As the majority of people who call 999 are in an emergency situation which requires urgent support, the proportion of calls which were resolved with telephone advice only was low. From April 2011 to November 2013, this was roughly 5.0% of calls. However, from November 2013 to June 2015 there was a steady increase in calls resolved with telephone advice only. The most recent data for July 2015 ends this trend with a decrease of 0.2%.

Roughly one third of calls to 999 were visited by an ambulance but the person didn't need to go to hospital. This has increased slightly over time and was 37.7% in July 2015.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
